intro: Phthirusa subcorymbosa, commonly known as the small-leafed phthirusa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phthirusa subcorymbosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
